title: BOOKSTORE / PLAISANCE
description: Inside the book shop. Speaking with the proprietor.

dialogueTree.title: Plaisance: ""It's always nice to see you here...."
dialogueTree.text: "It's always nice to see you here. You bring good energy."

links.title: You: ""Seriously, I need to get to the fr..."
links.text: "Seriously, I need to get to the fridge in the cellar -- it's a police matter. I have a *dead body* to take care of."

links.title: Plaisance: ""A dead what?" Her eyes widen with..."
links.text: "A dead what?" Her eyes widen with shock at the mention. "Oh my god, a victim of the curse? The curse has started killing people? It's *killing* now?!" She grabs her head with both hands.

links.title: You: ""You're right, the curse is worse t..."
links.text: "You're right, the curse is worse than ever -- that's why you need to let me in there to investigate."

links.title: Plaisance: ""You're right..." She is mortified...."
links.text: "You're right..." She is mortified. "It's worse than I imagined. We definitely have to contain it now!"

links.title: Drama: "Yessss, this is your chance! Only a..."
links.text: Yessss, this is your chance! Only a *remote viewer* can solve this case.

links.title: Suggestion: "This definitely softened her up."
links.text: This definitely softened her up.

links.title: Drama: "Yessss, this is your chance! This i..."
links.text: Yessss, this is your chance! This is your chance! Only a *para-detective* can solve this case.

links.title: You: ""Enough of this mumbo-jumbo, I have..."
links.text: "Enough of this mumbo-jumbo, I have a decomposing body rotting away as we speak. Just let me in!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Absolutely not." She is mortified...."
links.text: "Absolutely not." She is mortified. "It's more dangerous than I ever imagined. I definitely can't let you in now, we have to contain it."

links.title: You: ""You *have to* let me to the cellar..."
links.text: "You *have to* let me to the cellar. There's something I desperately need from there."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Who, what? I don't understand what..."
links.text: "Who, what? I don't understand what you're talking about. I can't, in good conscience, risk releasing the *bane of doom* upon all because you need something from the cellar."

links.title: You: ""It's not just *something from the..."
links.text: "It's not just *something from the cellar*, I'm doing it for your previous neighbour -- Soona Luukanen-Kilde."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh, you mean that girl with those..."
links.text: "Oh, you mean that girl with those *bizarre* machines? Hmpf! I recall her now... her energetic presence was off, *very* off. She kept rambling something about her memory being lost..."

links.title: Logic: "Her *filament* memory."
links.text: Her *filament* memory.

links.title: Plaisance: ""In fact," she pauses to think, "It..."
links.text: "In fact," she pauses to think, "It's odd how many of these troubles started with her departure. How do I know she's not behind the curse?! We definitely have to contain it now."

links.title: You: ""I had a few more questions about t..."
links.text: "I had a few more questions about the curse..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Okay, but please, only a few quest..."
links.text: "Okay, but please, only a few questions." She peers at the curtains. "You wouldn't want to disturb the spirits..."

links.title: You: ""How does this curse manifest itsel..."
links.text: "How does this curse manifest itself?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""The curse... is so much worse than..."
links.text: "The curse... is so much worse than you could imagine. It's a *disease*, eating at the very foundation." A shiver runs through the woman, as she looks around the dimly lit store.

links.title: Plaisance: ""It's the curse of *financial distr..."
links.text: "It's the curse of *financial distress*." Her voice drops to a whisper. "Of *ruin* -- and bankruptcy." She peers at the curtains again...

links.title: Inland Empire: "Didn't... didn't that curtain just..."
links.text: Didn't... didn't that curtain just *move*?!

links.title: You: ""Okay. I'm a little confused. What..."
links.text: "Okay. I'm a little confused. What does that mean?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Everyone knows that all the previo..."
links.text: "Everyone knows that all the previous companies in this building have sooner or later declared bankruptcy. And their *malicious spirits* are still here, feeding off bad business practices and disappointing income statements!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""There's something *wrong* with thi..."
links.text: "There's something *wrong* with this building, I can tell you. Ever since I arrived, I've sensed an eerie lingering presence -- as if I was *unwanted* here."

links.title: Empathy: "Sounds familiar."
links.text: Sounds familiar.

links.title: You: ""Strange... I feel unwanted too. Wh..."
links.text: "Strange... I feel unwanted too. What does it mean?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Truly so?" Her eyes narrow, as she..."
links.text: "Truly so?" Her eyes narrow, as she tries to get a read on your energy. "Perhaps the dark energies are leeching off you? You shouldn't stay in the store too long, it may be dangerous."

links.title: You: "Don't mention it."
links.text: Don't mention it.

links.title: Plaisance: "She nudges her glasses, anxious and..."
links.text: She nudges her glasses, anxious and tense.

links.title: You: ""Ah! Annette mentioned that the pre..."
links.text: "Ah! Annette mentioned that the previous tenants have experienced some financial troubles."

links.title: Plaisance: ""It's not just that, officer, we're..."
links.text: "It's not just that, officer, we're dealing with something *supra-natural* here. It's the *caco-daemons* feeding off bad business practices and disappointing income statements!"

links.title: You: ""Wait, that's it? I was hoping for..."
links.text: "Wait, that's it? I was hoping for something more... *paranatural*."

links.title: Plaisance: ""But officer, there's nothing *natu..."
links.text: "But officer, there's nothing *natural* about entire companies declaring bankruptcy! I'm talking about *caco-daemons* feeding off bad business practices and disappointing income statements!"

links.title: You: ""Why didn't you just tell me right..."
links.text: "Why didn't you just tell me right away it's the curse?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""It's not good to talk about the cu..."
links.text: "It's not good to talk about the curse, not in detail. The negativism..." She shivers. "It's dangerous. Talking about the void wraiths angers them!"

links.title: Conceptualization: "Wow. *Void wraiths*. You have new w..."
links.text: Wow. *Void wraiths*. You have new words.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Such wraiths may prove a formidable..."
links.text: Such wraiths may prove a formidable enemy. Suit up.

links.title: You: ""Have you sought help from anyone?""
links.text: "Have you sought help from anyone?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Yes, I've contacted numerous parap..."
links.text: "Yes, I've contacted numerous parapsychologists and even a pair of Semenese mediators -- they provided me with the wards." She nods at the strange cage-like trinket on the curtains.

links.title: Plaisance: ""The wards help to keep the doom at..."
links.text: "The wards help to keep the doom at bay and protect us against the darkness that lies further in the building. Even though now I fear... it's not enough."

links.title: You: ""Is your pendant part of the wards..."
links.text: "Is your pendant part of the wards as well?" (Point at her necklace.)

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh, this?" She holds the pendant i..."
links.text: "Oh, this?" She holds the pendant in her palm. Its ochre heart glistens under the lights. "No. It's a special *Himean amulet* blessed by desert pygmy shamans with a *spell of compulsion*. It's to compel people to buy books..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""There are numerous spells cast thr..."
links.text: "There are numerous spells cast throughout the store. I had the books anointed with a different inducement spell, for example." She nods. "It's guaranteed to boost sales *fifteen percent*!"

links.title: Rhetoric: "Desert pygmy shamans...? That sound..."
links.text: Desert pygmy shamans...? That sounds like a rather questionable way to describe a group of people.

links.title: Logic: "Doesn't seem like the spell is work..."
links.text: Doesn't seem like the spell is working... There are no customers around except you.

links.title: You: ""There are hardly any customers in..."
links.text: "There are hardly any customers in the store. Do you think it's really working?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Sir, I am well-educated in the com..."
links.text: "Sir, I am well-educated in the commercial and esoteric arts. I know what to do and what to avoid." She nudges her spectacles.

links.title: You: ""Have you ever thought about a sale..."
links.text: "Have you ever thought about a sale? Maybe this could lure in some customers."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Discount my wares?! I can see, sir..."
links.text: "Discount my wares?! I can see, sir, that you don't value books very highly."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Besides, this would only tempt the..."
links.text: "Besides, this would only tempt the phantoms of doom... They can sense the desperation, you know."

links.title: You: ""I'm only trying to help... What ab..."
links.text: "I'm only trying to help... What about some neon signs and blinking lights?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Sir, this is a bookstore, not a st..."
links.text: "Sir, this is a bookstore, not a stripclub. No one would take us seriously if we put up some horrendous neon lights."

links.title: You: ""You could try to be friendlier wit..."
links.text: "You could try to be friendlier with the customers."

links.title: Plaisance: ""My voice is trained to perfection..."
links.text: "My voice is trained to perfection by true sales professionals, good sir! I paid good money for those courses."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Too much money, even..." She looks..."
links.text: "Too much money, even..." She looks around the dusty store. "Perhaps I should have bought some wards instead."

links.title: You: ""Maybe you should try to *reconcept..."
links.text: "Maybe you should try to *reconceptualize* your business... Martinaise doesn't look like the best place for a bookshop."

links.title: Plaisance: "She stands silent for a second, bef..."
links.text: She stands silent for a second, before exhaling sharply. "You're right. A bookstore wasn't even my original plan, I actually wanted to sell esoteric paraphernalia to help to balance out this neighbourhood's dark energies."

links.title: You: ""Great idea. What happened?""
links.text: "Great idea. What happened?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""My husband suggested otherwise. He..."
links.text: "My husband suggested otherwise. He said it's less... stupid. More appropriate. Cultured and all that."

links.title: Plaisance: ""But being *cultured* doesn't offer..."
links.text: "But being *cultured* doesn't offer any protection against the curse, does it?" She looks around the dusty store. "Maybe I shouldn't have listened to him after all..."

links.title: You: ""I'm not sure that a trinket shop i..."
links.text: "I'm not sure that a trinket shop is a better idea for business."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Well, my husband would definitely..."
links.text: "Well, my husband would definitely agree with you." Her mouth has become a single tight line. "He's the one who suggested selling books. Less... *stupid*, he said. More *cultured*."

links.title: You: ""Honestly, it seems like this penda..."
links.text: "Honestly, it seems like this pendant thing is a scam. You could be doing so much more."

links.title: You: ""What about the wards on the back d..."
links.text: "What about the wards on the back door? Are these Semenese as well?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Yes, the Semenese are very crafty..."
links.text: "Yes, the Semenese are very crafty and their wards are extremely powerful. Lesser wards simply won't do here."

links.title: You: ""And what's behind that door if I m..."
links.text: "And what's behind that door if I may ask?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Failure... so much more failure!"..."
links.text: "Failure... so much more failure!" She turns away from you, shaking her head.

links.title: You: ""I heard that the Union has squeeze..."
links.text: "I heard that the Union has squeezed out all the local business to fund their strike... How is your store still up and running?"

links.title: Plaisance: "She fingers the pendant around her..."
links.text: She fingers the pendant around her neck, thinking. "It must be these very spells and wards of protection that keep me safe from all the ill and wicked deeds."

links.title: You: ""Would you like me to take the case..."
links.text: "Would you like me to take the case? I could investigate, see if the curse is real." (Conclude.)

links.title: Plaisance: ""Most certainly not! I don't want a..."
links.text: "Most certainly not! I don't want anyone who's not familiar with the psychic arts to get involved in this mess. Stay away. Leave the spirits be, so they can return to their slumber."

links.title: Drama: "My liege! You know what this case c..."
links.text: My liege! You know what this case calls for? A para-detective!

links.title: Suggestion: "Tell her there's a *dead body* invo..."
links.text: Tell her there's a *dead body* involved. That will make it easier.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Wait, mention the *dead body*! Peop..."
links.text: Wait, mention the *dead body*! People hate those.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Psychic arts? Sounds right down our..."
links.text: Psychic arts? Sounds right down our alley.

links.title: You: ""I don't think the curse is real, I..."
links.text: "I don't think the curse is real, I just want you to let me in there." (Conclude.)

links.title: Plaisance: ""Most certainly not! I'm not lettin..."
links.text: "Most certainly not! I'm not letting you open the gates of hell. In fact, I don't want *anyone* who isn't familiar with the psychic arts involved in this mess. Stay away. Leave the spirits be, so they can return to their slumber."

links.title: You: ""Never mind, I had other questions.""
links.text: "Never mind, I had other questions."

links.title: Plaisance: "The woman looks aloof, her features..."
links.text: The woman looks aloof, her features much softer. Occasionally she glances at her daughter's silhouette.

links.title: Plaisance: "The woman before you scans the stor..."
links.text: The woman before you scans the store, her shoulders rigid and tense. Every now and then she nudges her glasses.

links.title: You: ""Never mind, I had other questions.""
links.text: "Never mind, I had other questions."

links.title: You: ""Why are you so uptight about those..."
links.text: "Why are you so uptight about those curtains? I just want to know what's on the other side."

links.title: Plaisance: ""I already told you, it's just a st..."
links.text: "I already told you, it's just a storage room for employees! I don't understand why it's so important to you..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Just let it go, officer! Go buy so..."
links.text: "Just let it go, officer! Go buy some god damn books, you're supposed to be... *drawn* to the books!"

links.title: Drama: "She recites it like it's a poem, or..."
links.text: She recites it like it's a poem, or like she's playing a role she's grown tired of.

links.title: Composure: "She's so tense it's a miracle she h..."
links.text: She's so tense it's a miracle she hasn't snapped in half yet.

links.title: You: ""Why are you still talking about bo..."
links.text: "Why are you still talking about books? Are you trying to put a spell on me?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""A spell! As if!" She snorts. "This..."
links.text: "A spell! As if!" She snorts. "This place doesn't need any spells or hoo-doo mumbo-jumbo, this place has *wonderful* energy!" She wavers under your gaze, mouth pressed into a tight-lipped smile... then something breaks:

links.title: Plaisance: ""Okay... fine! It's because this pl..."
links.text: "Okay... fine! It's because this place is *cursed*, just like Annette said! They don't call it the Doomed Commercial Area for nothing!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Are you happy now, officer? Happy..."
links.text: "Are you happy now, officer? Happy that you've *ruined* everything?" She closes her eyes and starts mumbling something to her pendant.

links.title: Plaisance: ""Okay... fine! It's because this pl..."
links.text: "Okay... fine! It's because this place is *cursed*, just like everyone said! They don't call it the Doomed Commercial Area for nothing!"

links.title: You: ""If it's just a storage room then w..."
links.text: "If it's just a storage room then why are you so tense?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""I'm not tense, I'm just..." She wa..."
links.text: "I'm not tense, I'm just..." She wavers under your gaze, mouth pressed into a tight-lipped frown... then something breaks:

links.title: You: ""If it's just a storage room then w..."
links.text: "If it's just a storage room then why does it have a Semenese ward protecting it?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""It's just for decoration!" She wav..."
links.text: "It's just for decoration!" She wavers under your gaze, mouth pressed into a tight-lipped smile... then something breaks:

links.title: You: ""If it's just a storage room then w..."
links.text: "If it's just a storage room then why do you have that strange trinket on the curtains?"

links.title: You: ""It's not just a storage room, I al..."
links.text: "It's not just a storage room, I already looked... There's another door behind the curtains."

links.title: Plaisance: ""*What-did-you-do?!*" she demands i..."
links.text: "*What-did-you-do?!*" she demands in a single breath, hand clasped around the pendant. "You *looked?*"

links.title: You: ""Yes, when you weren't paying atten..."
links.text: "Yes, when you weren't paying attention."

links.title: Plaisance: ""You *looked*, you let the spirits..."
links.text: "You *looked*, you let the spirits in!" she shouts, her face getting red. "We are all doomed now, this place is cursed, just like Annette said. They don't call it the Doomed Commercial Area just for nothing!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""You *looked*, you let the spirits..."
links.text: "You *looked*, you let the spirits in!" Her face is getting red. "We are all doomed now, this place is cursed, just like everyone said. They don't call it the Doomed Commercial Area just for nothing!"

links.title: You: ""It's not like I ripped the curtain..."
links.text: "It's not like I ripped the curtains open or anything, it was just a little peek..."

links.title: You: ""No, you misunderstood me -- I didn..."
links.text: "No, you misunderstood me -- I didn't 'look' with my 'eyes', I used my inner vision to 'get a read' on the Darkness... *metaphysically*."

links.title: Plaisance: ""The Darkness..." She closes her ey..."
links.text: "The Darkness..." She closes her eyes and nods. "It must be real then... This place is cursed, just like Annette said. They don't call it the Doomed Commercial Area just for nothing!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""I'm not sure whether I want to kno..."
links.text: "I'm not sure whether I want to know what else the spirits have told you in your *visions*..." She shudders and starts mumbling something to her pendant.

links.title: Plaisance: ""And you saw a *door*?" She closes..."
links.text: "And you saw a *door*?" She closes her eyes. "It must be real then... This place is cursed, just like everyone said. They don't call it the Doomed Commercial Area just for nothing!"

links.title: You: ""It's not just a storage room, I al..."
links.text: "It's not just a storage room, I already saw that... There's another door behind the curtains."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Of course it's not just a storage..."
links.text: "Of course it's not just a storage room!" she suddenly shouts, her face getting red. "But what does it matter now, you already let the spirits in... We are all doomed now."

links.title: Plaisance: ""It's just like Annette said, this..."
links.text: "It's just like Annette said, this place is cursed. They don't call it the Doomed Commercial Area just for nothing." She closes her eyes, visibly defeated, and starts mumbling something to her pendant.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): ""Host of Hosts," she prays, "guard..."
links.text: "Host of Hosts," she prays, "guard me and my honest business venture from the curse that lurks behind the curtains..."

links.title: Suggestion: "Take it easy. You've broken her res..."
links.text: Take it easy. You've broken her resistance. Pushing her further will gain nothing.

links.title: Plaisance: ""It's just like everyone said, this..."
links.text: "It's just like everyone said, this place is cursed. They don't call it the Doomed Commercial Area just for nothing." She closes her eyes, visibly defeated, and starts mumbling something to her pendant.

links.title: You: ""If it's just a storage room then i..."
links.text: "If it's just a storage room then it wouldn't hurt if I just peeked inside... It's not like it's *cursed*, right?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""No!" She wavers under your gaze, m..."
links.text: "No!" She wavers under your gaze, mouth pressed into a tight-lipped frown... then she breaks down:

links.title: You: ""If it's just a storage room then i..."
links.text: "If it's just a storage room then it wouldn't hurt if I just peeked inside..."

links.title: You: ""I was told that there's a huge fri..."
links.text: "I was told that there's a huge fridge in the building's cellar. Can you lead me there?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""A fridge?" She fidgets with her pe..."
links.text: "A fridge?" She fidgets with her pendant. "No, I don't know anything about a fridge. Aren't you interested in books?" She nods at the bookshelves.

links.title: Drama: "For whatever reason she's lying to..."
links.text: For whatever reason she's lying to you about the fridge. Seems like you have to find your own way to the cellar.

links.title: You: ""I'm looking for a book about cocka..."
links.text: "I'm looking for a book about cockatoos."

links.title: Plaisance: ""A book about cockatoos? There shou..."
links.text: "A book about cockatoos? There should be one upstairs, right next to the shelf of biographies."

links.title: You: ""Uh, this Dick Mullen book fell apa..."
links.text: "Uh, this Dick Mullen book fell apart before I got to the end. Do you have another copy?" (Show her the item.)

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh, I'm very sorry, sir. Some of t..."
links.text: "Oh, I'm very sorry, sir. Some of these old paperbacks just don't have the durability. I would be happy to sell you another one, but unfortunately it's the last copy we had in stock."

links.title: Half Light: "She calls that customer service?!"
links.text: She calls that customer service?!

links.title: You: ""What if I want to buy a book?""
links.text: "What if I want to buy a book?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Goodness, you were already doing g..."
links.text: "Goodness, you were already doing good browsing the shelves. Why'd you stop?" She fiddles her pendant, then waves her bony fingers directly at you: "Don't you feel compelled? Go, go -- get back there. The books await you."

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "Quietly, she mutters to herself: "H..."
links.text: Quietly, she mutters to herself: "He isn't doing what he's designed to do... isn't the spell working..."

links.title: You: ""What spell?""
links.text: "What spell?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Huh?" She flinches at your remark...."
links.text: "Huh?" She flinches at your remark. "Nothing. No one's cast any spells of compulsion to draw in customers. What a silly idea!"

links.title: You: ""So what types of books do you have?""
links.text: "So what types of books do you have?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Everything is on the shelves, take..."
links.text: "Everything is on the shelves, take a look yourself." She nudges her glasses. "The shelves compel you, don't they?"

links.title: Volition: "She's attempting to mentally direct..."
links.text: She's attempting to mentally direct you towards the shelves. She only wants you to buy the goods, she doesn't care about books.

links.title: You: ""Do you even know what books you ha..."
links.text: "Do you even know what books you have for sale?"

links.title: Plaisance: "She scoffs. "Truth be told, not rea..."
links.text: She scoffs. "Truth be told, not really. My sister brings in most of the goods. I'm sure it's all very literary stuff, with *well-written prose*..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""But you don't learn about the *imp..."
links.text: "But you don't learn about the *important things* in life from fabricated stories."

links.title: You: ""Wait, shouldn't a storekeeper know..."
links.text: "Wait, shouldn't a storekeeper know about her wares?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""I provide a valuable service. As l..."
links.text: "I provide a valuable service. As long as people buy books, I'm fine." She wiggles her bony fingers at you.

links.title: You: ""Where do you learn about the *impo..."
links.text: "Where do you learn about the *important* things then?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""The truth is available if you just..."
links.text: "The truth is available if you just know where to look. And you have to open and free your mind to *understand*." She nods at you, cryptically.

links.title: You: ""Alright, I'll take a look then." (..."
links.text: "Alright, I'll take a look then." (Conclude.)

links.title: Plaisance: "She smiles and nods, seemingly reli..."
links.text: She smiles and nods, seemingly relieved.

links.title: Plaisance: ""Then why are you talking to me? Ev..."
links.text: "Then why are you talking to me? Everything is on the shelves to browse. Don't you feel *compelled* to buy anything?" She fiddles with her pendant, then waves her bony fingers directly at you: "See those shelves there, go, be drawn."

links.title: You: ""The girl outside mentioned that th..."
links.text: "The girl outside mentioned that this place is cursed."

links.title: Plaisance: ""*Cursed*? Who said that, Annette?"..."
links.text: "*Cursed*? Who said that, Annette?" She blinks. "I will have a word with her... This place is not cursed, it has a robustly *magnetic* energy. Good for commercial activity. My business is *thriving*, sir!"

links.title: Rhetoric: "What in god's name is she talking a..."
links.text: What in god's name is she talking about?

links.title: Empathy: "Doesn't feel like it's thriving. Fe..."
links.text: Doesn't feel like it's thriving. Feels ghostly.

links.title: You: ""Who's the little girl standing out..."
links.text: "Who's the little girl standing outside?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Yes? Oh, I hope I can make it up t..."
links.text: "Yes? Oh, I hope I can make it up to her. She's my precious kid."

links.title: You: ""Is this husband Annette's father?""
links.text: "Is this husband Annette's father?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Yes. My husband is a successful en..."
links.text: "Yes. My husband is a successful entrepreneur East of the river. If only he were more *involved* in the business we're running up *here*." She says gloomily. "No matter, soon we'll both be off for Grand Couron!"

links.title: You: ""Wait. Grand Couron? What's that?""
links.text: "Wait. Grand Couron? What's that?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""It's a *proper* place to live -- o..."
links.text: "It's a *proper* place to live -- one of the most peaceful neighbourhoods east of Jamrock. You may know it for its massive housing projects..."

links.title: Shivers: "Your head feels light and dizzy......"
links.text: Your head feels light and dizzy... a cold breeze caresses your flesh.

links.title: You: "What's going on?"
links.text: What's going on?

links.title: Shivers: "Monstrous buildings loom over Grand..."
links.text: Monstrous buildings loom over Grand Couron. A cold wind howls in the empty halls of homes built upon delusions.

links.title: You: "Why?"
links.text: Why?

links.title: Shivers: "There is no life in Grand Couron. N..."
links.text: There is no life in Grand Couron. No one can afford to live there.

links.title: You: "Shudder, let it pass."
links.text: Shudder, let it pass.

links.title: Plaisance: ""Most of the buildings are empty at..."
links.text: "Most of the buildings are empty at the moment!" Her smile is wide. "It's a great opportunity to get ahead of the crowds. Better times ahead, for sure."

links.title: You: ""And your husband's also involved w..."
links.text: "And your husband's also involved with the bookstore?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""He made the initial investment. Si..."
links.text: "He made the initial investment. Since then he's been what you might call a *silent partner*."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Super silent. Almost inaudibly so."
links.text: Super silent. Almost inaudibly so.

links.title: You: ""Is she an only child?""
links.text: "Is she an only child?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Yes, I'm afraid so. A real treat s..."
links.text: "Yes, I'm afraid so. A real treat she is. It would be nice if she had..." She pauses for a second. "No, we couldn't have afforded more children really. Not in this economy."

links.title: Composure: "A glimmer of sadness blinks through..."
links.text: A glimmer of sadness blinks through the well-crafted exterior.

links.title: You: ""Why not?""
links.text: "Why not?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""We're quite busy people, you know,..."
links.text: "We're quite busy people, you know, my husband and I. Quite busy." Her voice wavers a bit. "Children are a lot of work. You don't look like a father, so I don't expect you to understand..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""I'm sorry. She catches herself. "..."
links.text: "I'm sorry. She catches herself. "I'm sure you do understand."

links.title: You: ""Of course. Yes. This economy.""
links.text: "Of course. Yes. This economy."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Exactly." She agrees wholeheartedl..."
links.text: "Exactly." She agrees wholeheartedly.

links.title: You: ""She told me she doesn't go to scho..."
links.text: "She told me she doesn't go to school anymore."

links.title: Plaisance: ""She's been too busy, helping me he..."
links.text: "She's been too busy, helping me here, so she's studied at home this trimester. This is a temporary solution, of course." Plaisance nods.

links.title: Plaisance: ""I assure you, I of all people unde..."
links.text: "I assure you, I of all people understand the importance of *education*. She will be back in school the moment the store takes off."

links.title: Logic: "And hell freezes over? Never mind,..."
links.text: And hell freezes over? Never mind, it's not a good topic to get into.

links.title: You: ""Alright. I had something else in m..."
links.text: "Alright. I had something else in mind." (Conclude.)

links.title: Plaisance: "The woman looks aloof, her features..."
links.text: The woman looks aloof, her features much softer. Occasionally she glances at her daughter's silhouette.

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh, yes? How's my precious doing?..."
links.text: "Oh, yes? How's my precious doing? She's a good girl."

links.title: You: ""The way you're handling her strike..."
links.text: "The way you're handling her strikes me as wrong."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Mind your own business, sir." Her..."
links.text: "Mind your own business, sir." Her posture becomes very rigid. "In *our society*, people don't get to tell each other how to raise their children. It's none of your or anyone's business."

links.title: Logic: "Denial is the way she copes with cr..."
links.text: Denial is the way she copes with criticism.

links.title: You: ""Annette is quite the trooper. She'..."
links.text: "Annette is quite the trooper. She's a great value-add."

links.title: Plaisance: ""As a young girl should be. With th..."
links.text: "As a young girl should be. With the proper attitude she'll have a bright financial future."

links.title: You: ""I'm here to dismantle the free mar..."
links.text: "I'm here to dismantle the free market and abolish child labour."

links.title: Plaisance: "She rolls her eyes. "You must be ki..."
links.text: She rolls her eyes. "You must be kidding, there's nothing like that happening."

links.title: You: ""Depends. How much do you pay the k..."
links.text: "Depends. How much do you pay the kid?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Good sir, what does a young child..."
links.text: "Good sir, what does a young child do with money anyway? No, I save it for her, as a fund. She's securing her financial future out there."

links.title: Authority: "Slap the cuffs on her!"
links.text: Slap the cuffs on her!

links.title: Rhetoric: "Such criminal behaviour would not h..."
links.text: Such criminal behaviour would not happen in more developed countries.

links.title: You: ""I formally reprimand you for your..."
links.text: "I formally reprimand you for your corrupt activities."

links.title: Plaisance: "She raises an eyebrow. "Oh, of cour..."
links.text: She raises an eyebrow. "Oh, of course, officer. Good work. Are we done with the jokes now?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, we've had quite enough fun he..."
links.text: "Yes, we've had quite enough fun here, right." The lieutenant taps his foot.

links.title: You: ""In some more developed countries t..."
links.text: "In some more developed countries this sort of thing is two felonies. Child labour and slavery."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Those countries will realise they'..."
links.text: "Those countries will realise they've raised a lazy and spoiled generation." Her tone is decisive, not at all angry at the insinuation. "Are we done with the jokes now?"

links.title: You: ""Oh. I guess I was mistaken.""
links.text: "Oh. I guess I was mistaken."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Indeed." Her voice is decisive and..."
links.text: "Indeed." Her voice is decisive and sharp as a knife. "Are we done with the jokes now?"

links.title: You: ""All this pressure has made her rea..."
links.text: "All this pressure has made her really anxious. You know she's been chewing her nails?"

links.title: You: ""Okay.... Let's change the subject.""
links.text: "Okay.... Let's change the subject."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Annette, yes. My daughter. I hope..."
links.text: "Annette, yes. My daughter. I hope she wasn't slacking off again with her nose in science fiction! Tell me, was she at her post, doing her job like a proper girl?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, of course.""
links.text: "Yes, of course."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Wonderful! Did you talk to her?""
links.text: "Wonderful! Did you talk to her?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Great! On a scale of one to ten, h..."
links.text: "Great! On a scale of one to ten, how compelled were you to buy books after talking with her?"

links.title: Empathy: "Her opinion of her daughter depends..."
links.text: Her opinion of her daughter depends on how well she lured you into the store.

links.title: You: ""Ten. She's certainly very polite a..."
links.text: "Ten. She's certainly very polite and helpful."

links.title: Plaisance: ""My precious! Her dedication brings..."
links.text: "My precious! Her dedication brings joy to my heart." She's immensely satisfied with the answer. "If you have children, I hope they turn out as great as my Annette."

links.title: You: ""Five. I felt some interest.""
links.text: "Five. I felt some interest."

links.title: Plaisance: ""I guess it's better than nothing."..."
links.text: "I guess it's better than nothing." She shrugs. "She'll have to try harder next time."

links.title: You: ""One. Not impressed.""
links.text: "One. Not impressed."

links.title: Plaisance: ""I knew it." She sighs and shakes h..."
links.text: "I knew it." She sighs and shakes her head. "Shameful behaviour. She's incorrigible."

links.title: You: ""I'm not going to grade a human bei..."
links.text: "I'm not going to grade a human being. I don't do that."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Come now, it's not personal, it's..."
links.text: "Come now, it's not personal, it's about proper sales practices and market research." She crosses her arms. "I expect an answer."

links.title: You: ""Not really.""
links.text: "Not really."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Why not? Was she not friendly enou..."
links.text: "Why not? Was she not friendly enough? Were you not compelled to talk to her?"

links.title: You: ""I don't know, I just walked right..."
links.text: "I don't know, I just walked right in here instead."

links.title: Plaisance: "She lightens up. "Oh yes, okay, tha..."
links.text: She lightens up. "Oh yes, okay, that makes sense. It's working then... yes. Do browse our books, sir!"

links.title: You: ""I'm not interested in talking to a..."
links.text: "I'm not interested in talking to a kid."

links.title: Plaisance: ""What's wrong with her?" She shakes..."
links.text: "What's wrong with her?" She shakes her head. "Can't she do anything right?"

links.title: You: ""I was afraid she'd call me a f****..."
links.text: "I was afraid she'd call me a f****t like all the kids around here."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Sir! Watch the language." She cros..."
links.text: "Sir! Watch the language." She crosses her arms. "My child would never do such a thing."

links.title: You: ""No, she was definitely slacking of..."
links.text: "No, she was definitely slacking off."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh," she exclaims with some irrita..."
links.text: "Oh," she exclaims with some irritation. "Shameful girl, what is she up to this time?!"

links.title: You: ""No, I must've been mistaken. She's..."
links.text: "No, I must've been mistaken. She's right outside, very attentive, yes."

links.title: You: ""This is actually none of my busine..."
links.text: "This is actually none of my business, let's talk about something else."

links.title: You: ""It doesn't matter. Now, tell me so..."
links.text: "It doesn't matter. Now, tell me something else..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Hmpf!" She seems disappointed, lik..."
links.text: "Hmpf!" She seems disappointed, like a kid who's been told no. "And what else can I do for you?"

links.title: You: ""All the pressure has made Annette..."
links.text: "All the pressure has made Annette really anxious. You know she's been chewing her nails?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""God, I've told her not to do that...."
links.text: "God, I've told her not to do that. It's disgusting. And I told *you* to mind your own business." Her voice is firm. "Clearly you have no idea how hard it is to raise a girl in this economy."

links.title: Inland Empire: "*This economy* is a mysterious forc..."
links.text: *This economy* is a mysterious force, like cosmic weather. Mysterious and harsh.

links.title: You: ""I don't think she can do anything..."
links.text: "I don't think she can do anything about it."

links.title: Plaisance: ""She can, if she has enough *willpo..."
links.text: "She can, if she has enough *willpower*. This is what's called *growing pains*. Life isn't easy, life doesn't give breaks."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Come on, ma'am. It's obvious she c..."
links.text: "Come on, ma'am. It's obvious she can't do anything about it. You're placing an unnecessary burden on a young child."

links.title: You: ""What you're doing is wrong. Even I..."
links.text: "What you're doing is wrong. Even I know that, and I usually don't know anything."

links.title: Plaisance: "She stands stiff and severe, silent..."
links.text: She stands stiff and severe, silently fuming. Ten or so seconds pass without change.

links.title: Volition: "This is a person coming to terms wi..."
links.text: This is a person coming to terms with a new reality. One where they are *wrong*. It's not easy.

links.title: Rhetoric: "She's looking for one -- but there..."
links.text: She's looking for one -- but there simply aren't any good arguments for being an asshole.

links.title: Plaisance: "All of a sudden she exhales sharply..."
links.text: All of a sudden she exhales sharply. Her shoulders slump down. "Oh no..." she mutters. "Hold on, I need to invite her inside and apologize. She must be freezing out there..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""There," she returns with a nod. "I..."
links.text: "There," she returns with a nod. "I don't know what to say to you. My husband, he tries to teach me business lessons. I have... what my mother called a *dull mind*. All this stress..." She stops, but her mouth keeps moving.

links.title: Empathy: "It sounds like both the husband and..."
links.text: It sounds like both the husband and the mother treat her the way she treats Annette.

links.title: You: ""You're like Annette to your husban..."
links.text: "You're like Annette to your husband. And your mother."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh..." She nudges her glasses nerv..."
links.text: "Oh..." She nudges her glasses nervously. "Well. My mother was horrible, of course, absolutely *perverse* energies around that person, but my husband..." She shakes her head.

links.title: Empathy: "...my husband is completely differe..."
links.text: ...my husband is completely different. Of course.

links.title: You: "Just nod compassionately."
links.text: Just nod compassionately.

links.title: Empathy: "Yes. Sometimes it's better to let p..."
links.text: Yes. Sometimes it's better to let people come to these conclusions themselves.

links.title: You: ""That *is* true -- and obviously th..."
links.text: "That *is* true -- and obviously the will of the market -- but maybe make an exception for your daughter?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, actually it's super all righ..."
links.text: "Yeah, actually it's super all right for kids to chew their hands off. Forget I said anything."

links.title: You: ""Okay. Forget it." (None of your bu..."
links.text: "Okay. Forget it." (None of your business.)

links.title: Plaisance: ""God, ugh, I've told her not to do..."
links.text: "God, ugh, I've told her not to do that. It's such a disgusting habit." Her voice is firm. "She'll get over it. Anxiety is a part of life."

links.title: Empathy: "A part of hers too, clearly."
links.text: A part of hers too, clearly.

links.title: You: "Convince her to let you investigate..."
links.text: Convince her to let you investigate the Doomed Commercial Area.

links.title: Drama: "Slither up to her, you silver-tongu..."
links.text: Slither up to her, you silver-tongued fiend. Show her what world-class perfidy looks like!

links.title: Inland Empire: "Perfidy? Oh no, we're afraid the pr..."
links.text: Perfidy? Oh no, we're afraid the presence is VERY REAL.

links.title: You: "Wait, what if I don't want to lie....."
links.text: Wait, what if I don't want to lie...

links.title: Drama: "You're not *lying* -- you're giving..."
links.text: You're not *lying* -- you're giving her peace of mind. The meanssss are thus jusssstified.

links.title: You: ""Ma'am, I came here to help. I've h..."
links.text: "Ma'am, I came here to help. I've handled *paranatural* situations before."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Are you sure?" She looks sceptical..."
links.text: "Are you sure?" She looks sceptical. "Don't think I haven't seen *charlatans* before..."

links.title: You: ""I sensed the psychic emanations fr..."
links.text: "I sensed the psychic emanations from afar. The Sleeper Beyond calls out."

links.title: Plaisance: "She shudders. "I'm not sure I can t..."
links.text: She shudders. "I'm not sure I can trust your claims -- honestly, you look like a bit of a drinker. I'm sorry for being so blunt, but..."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Hey now, hey. Hey! Hey. You need th..."
links.text: Hey now, hey. Hey! Hey. You need the booze to focus, alright?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant keeps his usual ston..."
links.text: The lieutenant keeps his usual stony calm. He silently picks out his notebook.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Go ahead then. Rock her world, he t..."
links.text: Go ahead then. Rock her world, he thinks. I'll compose some notes.

links.title: You: ""I admit, I've had my share of drin..."
links.text: "I admit, I've had my share of drinks, but only because *mediation* is so draining."

links.title: Plaisance: ""How do you... *know* all this?""
links.text: "How do you... *know* all this?"

links.title: Drama: "Here we go!"
links.text: Here we go!

links.title: You: ""Your wards brought me here in the..."
links.text: "Your wards brought me here in the first place. The Semenese blood also runs through me."

links.title: Plaisance: ""You're part Semenese?! Oh, it mean..."
links.text: "You're part Semenese?! Oh, it means our meeting couldn't have been mere chance... the hand of fate guides us."

links.title: Half Light: "Blech! You deny your own Revacholia..."
links.text: Blech! You deny your own Revacholian blood for the sake of a lie!

links.title: You: ""I used to live on the shadowy isle..."
links.text: "I used to live on the shadowy isles... the wild wisemen taught me their rituals."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh my, I should have known! You do..."
links.text: "Oh my, I should have known! You do have that *wild-man* look. Our meeting couldn't have been mere chance!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""But... I am not the only one at ri..."
links.text: "But... I am not the only one at risk, I have to think of my daughter. You are certain you can help us, keep us safe? I can't allow any *collateral damage* to hit us."

links.title: You: ""No problem whatsoever, your family..."
links.text: "No problem whatsoever, your family is safe, the phantoms are no match for me."

links.title: Plaisance: ""If you promise, good officer... th..."
links.text: "If you promise, good officer... then." She shuffles nervously. "You might be our last hope. Do you swear it?"

links.title: You: "(A hand on your heart.) "On my hono..."
links.text: (A hand on your heart.) "On my honour."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Thank you, sir." A timid sigh of r..."
links.text: "Thank you, sir." A timid sigh of relief, followed by a cautious smile. "There's one more thing I haven't told you about yet... *the Entity*."

links.title: Drama: "Do not act surprised. You know of t..."
links.text: Do not act surprised. You know of these things, sire.

links.title: You: ""The Entity?""
links.text: "The Entity?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Yes, a malignant *Entity* that liv..."
links.text: "Yes, a malignant *Entity* that lives inside the chimney... it takes the form of a woman. A witch, most likely. She or *it* must be connected to the curse somehow."

links.title: You: ""Chimneys aren't big enough for tha..."
links.text: "Chimneys aren't big enough for that."

links.title: Plaisance: ""No, this chimney is part of the bu..."
links.text: "No, this chimney is part of the building's central furnace and it's enormous. She has barricaded herself behind some metal security curtains... God knows what she's doing there."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Some unnatural magic, I assume." S..."
links.text: "Some unnatural magic, I assume." She shivers. "You should go find *the Entity* and ask what happened to all the companies in the building. What is the source of this curse? Here's the key to the warded door behind the curtains, take it."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh and... please, do return to me..."
links.text: "Oh and... please, do return to me after you've looked around. I'm quite... *anxious* to know what she has to say about the curse. What you *discover* in there..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Unbelievable darkness and ruin."
links.text: Unbelievable darkness and ruin.

links.title: Logic: "What you *discover*? Probably just..."
links.text: What you *discover*? Probably just office space -- and the damn fridge. Don't be scared.

links.title: Half Light: "What you *discover*? A demonic refr..."
links.text: What you *discover*? A demonic refrigerator! Perhaps the fridge will be the source of the curse...

links.title: Logic: "What you *discover*? Probably just..."
links.text: What you *discover*? Probably just some office space. Don't be scared.

links.title: You: ""Chimney... the passage between hea..."
links.text: "Chimney... the passage between heaven and hell, of course..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Yes, that chimney is part of the b..."
links.text: "Yes, that chimney is part of the building's central furnace and it's enormous. She has barricaded herself behind some metal security curtains... God knows what she's doing there."

links.title: You: ""Of course, the Entity..." (Close y..."
links.text: "Of course, the Entity..." (Close your eyes.) "For I have sensed its presence."

links.title: Plaisance: ""You have?" She gasps. "The Entity..."
links.text: "You have?" She gasps. "The Entity takes the form of a woman, a witch probably. I've suspected that she must be connected to the curse ever since I first saw her. Did you know that she lives inside the *chimney*?"

links.title: You: ""Actually, I'm not really feeling t..."
links.text: "Actually, I'm not really feeling the vibe anymore... The psychic force has left me."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Come now!" Her eyes light up. "Eno..."
links.text: "Come now!" Her eyes light up. "Enough with your jokes, no backing down anymore. Do I have your word?"

links.title: You: ""Just ask my partner, Kim. He'll vo..."
links.text: "Just ask my partner, Kim. He'll vouch for me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh, uh..." the lieutenant mumbles..."
links.text: "Oh, uh..." the lieutenant mumbles in minor confusion. He has not been listening closely enough. You've put him on the spot.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Certainly so, ma'am. I can assure..."
links.text: "Certainly so, ma'am. I can assure you my partner is eminent in this *particular* field."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can assure you, he is... a polic..."
links.text: "I can assure you, he is... a police officer. Very... knowledgeable."

links.title: You: ""I am the Void-Revenant. I have the..."
links.text: "I am the Void-Revenant. I have the powers to de-bad all the bad energies."

links.title: Plaisance: ""I should have realized... a patter..."
links.text: "I should have realized... a pattern lies within the fabric. The hand of fate guides us, our meeting couldn't have been mere chance."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Perhaps you truly *are* the one to..."
links.text: Perhaps you truly *are* the one to deliver this woman from the doom...

links.title: You: ""You see, it's necessary to drink t..."
links.text: "You see, it's necessary to drink the *spirits* in order to contact the *void*."

links.title: You: ""Al Gul hails from beyond the veil,..."
links.text: "Al Gul hails from beyond the veil, ma'am. Al Gul guides the way."

links.title: You: ""I know the Remote Viewers Division..."
links.text: "I know the Remote Viewers Division, they have taught me perception beyond this world."

links.title: Plaisance: ""No, it simply can't be!" She looks..."
links.text: "No, it simply can't be!" She looks at you with some puzzlement. "How can I trust you? You're clearly a heavy drinker, don't get me wrong..."

links.title: You: ""I have returned from the void. A p..."
links.text: "I have returned from the void. A para-detective from a long line of para-detectives."

links.title: Plaisance: ""You're no para-detective. You look..."
links.text: "You're no para-detective. You look nothing like one -- and you're clearly a drinker. Pardon me for being so blunt, but..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "...you look like one."
links.text: ...you look like one.

links.title: You: ""The presence is real in this build..."
links.text: "The presence is real in this building. I have felt it. It lurks. It hungers. But I can bring peace."

links.title: Drama: "You know, maybe this time you shoul..."
links.text: You know, maybe this time you should just be upfront with her?

links.title: You: ""Look, ma'am, I really need to get..."
links.text: "Look, ma'am, I really need to get in there. I'm a compulsive detective. I can't sleep until I've solved the mystery."

links.title: Plaisance: ""And others have to suffer terrible..."
links.text: "And others have to suffer terrible consequences just so you can sleep at night? I think not!"

links.title: You: "Goddamnit, you're completely unhelp..."
links.text: Goddamnit, you're completely unhelpful.

links.title: Drama: "'Tis a poor craftsman who blames hi..."
links.text: 'Tis a poor craftsman who blames his tools!

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Why are you bothering with this tir..."
links.text: Why are you bothering with this tiresome woman -- just open the curtains while she's distracted!

links.title: Drama: "Alright -- Take two!"
links.text: Alright -- Take two!

links.title: You: ""Dealing with ghosts is simple. You..."
links.text: "Dealing with ghosts is simple. You have to show them who's boss."

links.title: Plaisance: ""What does that even mean?""
links.text: "What does that even mean?"

links.title: You: ""*Extreme violence*. The wards only..."
links.text: "*Extreme violence*. The wards only make them invite their ghost-families. And the Semenese want that because they're in league with the ghosts."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Do you take me for a complete fool..."
links.text: "Do you take me for a complete fool?" She's getting irritated. "Leave it be and just go look at the books."

links.title: You: ""This so-called *curse* is nothing..."
links.text: "This so-called *curse* is nothing more than a simple case of collective delusion."

links.title: Plaisance: ""No, no, don't mock the spirits lik..."
links.text: "No, no, don't mock the spirits like that! They don't like it... it only makes them angrier. Leave it be."

links.title: You: ""This is nothing but fear for the s..."
links.text: "This is nothing but fear for the success of your business given a shape."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Too many failures for it to be a c..."
links.text: "Too many failures for it to be a coincidence... they were not careful. I will not take such risks. Leave it be!"

links.title: You: ""You think Dick Mullen could solve..."
links.text: "You think Dick Mullen could solve this? No way, time for a real detective..." (Flex them biceps.) "...to shine."

links.title: Plaisance: "She gives you a curious look -- you..."
links.text: She gives you a curious look -- you don't really understand what to make of it.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "She's into your masculine posturing..."
links.text: She's into your masculine posturing! Your lean -- uh... husky and chubby brawn -- is pure animal magnetism.

links.title: You: "Wink at her."
links.text: Wink at her.

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh for the love of... no!" She rol..."
links.text: "Oh for the love of... no!" She rolls her eyes, although a vague blush nearly cracks through her faade. "Go look at books instead of this nonsense."

links.title: You: "Do not wink at her."
links.text: Do not wink at her.

links.title: You: "These ideas are all worthless."
links.text: These ideas are all worthless.

links.title: Drama: "Thy sweet tongue drips not with hon..."
links.text: Thy sweet tongue drips not with honey today... yet, try thou must!

links.title: Drama: "Time to fire up the old lie machine..."
links.text: Time to fire up the old lie machine!

links.title: You: ""Ma'am, do you know how me and my p..."
links.text: "Ma'am, do you know how me and my partner are known to our colleagues back at the station?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""No?" The storekeeper has crossed h..."
links.text: "No?" The storekeeper has crossed her arms.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at you, waitin..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks at you, waiting to see where this is going.

links.title: Drama: "You've got this. Just go with it, t..."
links.text: You've got this. Just go with it, this is *elegant*.

links.title: You: ""Crime bros." (Nod at Kim.) "We're..."
links.text: "Crime bros." (Nod at Kim.) "We're called *crime bros*, my partner and I."

links.title: Plaisance: ""You're called... *what*?" She peer..."
links.text: "You're called... *what*?" She peers at you over her glasses. "What is this, a joke, mister policeman? Do you commit *crimes* together or what?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He turns away, but not before you c..."
links.text: He turns away, but not before you can see a small hint of a smile -- he's struggling to not crack up.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Technically, that's what Crime Bros..."
links.text: Technically, that's what Crime Bros would do, yes. Commit crimes.

links.title: You: ""Uh... Sorry, this came out wrong a..."
links.text: "Uh... Sorry, this came out wrong again."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Not this nonsense again. I already..."
links.text: "Not this nonsense again. I already said *no*!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Sir, I really don't have time for..."
links.text: "Sir, I really don't have time for your jokes. The situation is very serious."

links.title: You: ""No, not like this, we're called cr..."
links.text: "No, not like this, we're called crime bros because we like to *solve* crimes... as brothers in arms!"

links.title: You: "Wait... That's it? I don't want to..."
links.text: Wait... That's it? I don't want to say that!

links.title: Drama: "Stop being such a fussy prude! You..."
links.text: Stop being such a fussy prude! You can't convince her without liessssss.

links.title: You: "Okay, I guess I'll give it a try: "..."
links.text: Okay, I guess I'll give it a try: "Crime Bros." (Nod at Kim.) "We're called *crime bros*, my partner and I."

links.title: You: "No, it's really stupid."
links.text: No, it's really stupid.

links.title: You: ""Ma'am, I am a renowned private inv..."
links.text: "Ma'am, I am a renowned private investigator, a paragon of law and a specialist in all things criminal."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant shoots you a sideway..."
links.text: The lieutenant shoots you a sideways glance. "And I am his private partner, John... Shao. Together we run the pre-eminent spousal surveillance firm in Revachol."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Shao is what the Seolite Empire was..."
links.text: Shao is what the Seolite Empire was called in the Occident, back when far less was known about the people. It was a barbarian Other, ever so mystical, on whom you could project any kind of exotic fantasy. The legend of it persists and a lot of people still think the 'Shao' is a thing.

links.title: You: ""We are truly private in our partne..."
links.text: "We are truly private in our partnership."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Once we've caught our client's spo..."
links.text: "Once we've caught our client's spouse *in flagrante delicto*, we blackmail them and pocket the money ourselves, because that's what private investigators do. Now, I see that *you* are a married woman..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Some penetrating sarcasm from your..."
links.text: Some penetrating sarcasm from your colleague there.

links.title: Plaisance: ""What nonsense are you two going on..."
links.text: "What nonsense are you two going on about? This is not relevant at all. And besides," her lip curls in disgust, "*my* husband would never do such a thing. We are proper people."

links.title: You: ""You shouldn't be so trusting of yo..."
links.text: "You shouldn't be so trusting of your husband. Men are filthy, treacherous pigs."

links.title: Plaisance: ""This is preposterous, a waste of m..."
links.text: "This is preposterous, a waste of my time and of no help to anyone." She looks displeased.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Our sincere apologies, ma'am. No m..."
links.text: "Our sincere apologies, ma'am. No more nonsense. We're offering to assist you with your troubles, *pro bono*." Despite his apologies, there's a twinge of amusement in the lieutenant's eye.

links.title: You: ""That's right, and all you have to..."
links.text: "That's right, and all you have to do is give us the key to the back door."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Is *that* what you've been after t..."
links.text: "Is *that* what you've been after this whole time? You want the key to the back door?"

links.title: You: ""Yes! The key! Can we have it?""
links.text: "Yes! The key! Can we have it?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Absolutely not!""
links.text: "Absolutely not!"

links.title: You: ""Enough funny business. Will you ju..."
links.text: "Enough funny business. Will you just give us the key already?"

links.title: You: ""It's a good offer, ma'am. I urge y..."
links.text: "It's a good offer, ma'am. I urge you to accept our help, it may be the only chance to save your business!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's right. When not spying on t..."
links.text: "That's right. When not spying on the love affairs of the ultra-rich, we solve unusual mysteries by the lorry-load."

links.title: You: ""What better way, than to ask us --""
links.text: "What better way, than to ask us --"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh my god, will you stop with the..."
links.text: "Oh my god, will you stop with the  incessant yammering? It's too much." Her palm goes to her face. "If you wanted the key to the back door you could have just asked for it."

links.title: You: ""Fine, I'll ask for it. Can we have..."
links.text: "Fine, I'll ask for it. Can we have the key?"

links.title: You: ""But I don't want to ask for it, as..."
links.text: "But I don't want to ask for it, asking is beneath me."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh? Well good for you, because you..."
links.text: "Oh? Well good for you, because you're not going to get it anyway!"

links.title: You: ""Mind your manners, John. This isn'..."
links.text: "Mind your manners, John. This isn't the great Shao Empire, where you can talk about sex stuff so openly!"

links.title: You: ""Alright, enough nonsense. The poin..."
links.text: "Alright, enough nonsense. The point is that we sometimes take on *unusual* cases."

links.title: Plaisance: ""How can I believe you after all th..."
links.text: "How can I believe you after all that foolishness?" She looks somewhat irritated.

links.title: You: ""But wait, there's more!""
links.text: "But wait, there's more!"

links.title: You: "I don't want to say all that."
links.text: I don't want to say all that.

links.title: Drama: "Yes, you do."
links.text: Yes, you do.

links.title: You: "You're right. What could go wrong?"
links.text: You're right. What could go wrong?

links.title: Drama: "Attaboy."
links.text: Attaboy.

links.title: You: "No. It's really stupid."
links.text: No. It's really stupid.

links.title: You: ""I talked to the *Entity* you told..."
links.text: "I talked to the *Entity* you told me about. Her name is Neha and she's a novelty dicemaker."

links.title: Plaisance: ""A novelty *dicemaker*?" Her eyes w..."
links.text: "A novelty *dicemaker*?" Her eyes widen. "Well, spit it out! Why does she need the dice -- for some kind of *sorcery*? Sometimes they use the ankle bones of sheep..."

links.title: You: ""She's not a sorceress -- or some '..."
links.text: "She's not a sorceress -- or some 'malicious Entity'. She's a businesswoman, like you."

links.title: Plaisance: ""I don't understand. If it's not he..."
links.text: "I don't understand. If it's not her, then where *is* the source of the Doom? How did she explain the *curse*?" She looks perplexed.

links.title: Endurance: "Before you say anything, ask yourse..."
links.text: Before you say anything, ask yourself. Is the woman really able to *withstand* the truth?

links.title: Logic: "The narrative she's built herself -..."
links.text: The narrative she's built herself -- it does need tearing down.

links.title: Composure: "She's squeezing on the pendant too..."
links.text: She's squeezing on the pendant too tight. A drop of blood in her palm...

links.title: Suggestion: "Just don't say you don't have *any*..."
links.text: Just don't say you don't have *any* answer yet. The uncertainty is killing her.

links.title: Drama: "To hell with it -- perchance you ou..."
links.text: To hell with it -- perchance you ought to just lie, sire?

links.title: Inland Empire: "You've come this far -- you know ho..."
links.text: You've come this far -- you know how to end it. There is an entity *behind* the entity.

links.title: You: ""She says there is no curse, becaus..."
links.text: "She says there is no curse, because there are too many inconsistencies."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Too many *inconsistencies*? What k..."
links.text: "Too many *inconsistencies*? What kind of talk is that?" The woman scoffs at you with an audible snort.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Good luck persuading her. Some peop..."
links.text: Good luck persuading her. Some people can rationalize *anything*.

links.title: You: ""First, *you're* one of those incon..."
links.text: "First, *you're* one of those inconsistencies."

links.title: Plaisance: ""I am not doing as well as it looks..."
links.text: "I am not doing as well as it looks like I am..." She grasps her pendant. "I only have my Semenese wards to thank for the protection they provide."

links.title: You: ""As I said, she's a novelty dicemak..."
links.text: "As I said, she's a novelty dicemaker. Her business has been up and running for a long time now."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Yes, because her business consists..."
links.text: "Yes, because her business consists of the *psychic leech* that's been feeding the curse!" Red blotches appear on her skin.

links.title: Plaisance: ""I see that you've fallen for her *..."
links.text: "I see that you've fallen for her *manipulation*, detective. The investigation is over. I just hope that you haven't made anything *worse* by going in there."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Thank you for nothing. Please, do..."
links.text: "Thank you for nothing. Please, do buy some books -- or be on your way, she concludes, tucking the pendant away in her blouse.

links.title: You: ""She said it's just capitalism. Ban..."
links.text: "She said it's just capitalism. Bankruptcy is a quirk of our economic system."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Wait, *WHAT*?" Her entire face goe..."
links.text: "Wait, *WHAT*?" Her entire face goes white as a skull. "The entire economic system is cursed?!"

links.title: Endurance: "This woman's not healthy enough to..."
links.text: This woman's not healthy enough to withstand this level of stress.

links.title: You: ""I'm afraid that only world revolut..."
links.text: "I'm afraid that only world revolution can help you." (Proceed.)

links.title: Plaisance: ""Another revolution?" She looks dow..."
links.text: "Another revolution?" She looks down at the pendant in her trembling hands, she collects herself.

links.title: Plaisance: ""I understand what's going on here...."
links.text: "I understand what's going on here. You went in there, rummaged around -- and accomplished nothing. And now you're telling me these *intellectual* things to cover up for it."

links.title: Plaisance: ""It's okay. You don't have to. I wa..."
links.text: "It's okay. You don't have to. I was wrong to trust another person. I will manage this psychic calamity as I always have -- alone. On my own..."

links.title: Volition: "As she has to -- every day."
links.text: As she has to -- every day.

links.title: Endurance: "Maybe you were wrong. She's endured..."
links.text: Maybe you were wrong. She's endured for at least four decades in this world.

links.title: You: ""Yes. The system must be *cleansed*..."
links.text: "Yes. The system must be *cleansed* of immigrant labour." (Proceed.)

links.title: Plaisance: ""Cleansed? What do you..." She look..."
links.text: "Cleansed? What do you..." She looks down at the pendant in her trembling hands, she collects herself.

links.title: You: ""It's true. We live in a precarious..."
links.text: "It's true. We live in a precarious world, nothing ever turns out right. You need to get used to chaos." (Proceed.)

links.title: Plaisance: ""Precarious world? Economy?" She lo..."
links.text: "Precarious world? Economy?" She looks down at the pendant in her trembling hands...

links.title: You: ""What I meant was... I found the so..."
links.text: "What I meant was... I found the source of the doom. Forget about the economy thing." (Back off.)

links.title: Plaisance: ""You found a way to fix our entire..."
links.text: "You found a way to fix our entire economic system...?" She peers at you suspiciously. "Or are you talking about the building?"

links.title: Empathy: "This is *a lot* for her to parse."
links.text: This is *a lot* for her to parse.

links.title: You: "(Lie.) "The source is in the taxide..."
links.text: (Lie.) "The source is in the taxidermist's shop. He became involved in arts darker than taxidermy and brought the void spirits down upon this place."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh! How horrid. I *knew* something..."
links.text: "Oh! How horrid. I *knew* something wasn't right about that place..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Tell me: Did you find a way to *br..."
links.text: "Tell me: Did you find a way to *break* the curse?"

links.title: You: ""Yes. I utilized the secret methods..."
links.text: "Yes. I utilized the secret methods of the Remote Viewers Division."

links.title: Plaisance: ""I understand that you can't divulg..."
links.text: "I understand that you can't divulge official secrets, officer. But know that I appreciate the efforts of your department." She looks at you with sudden admiration.

links.title: Plaisance: ""All that matters is that the energ..."
links.text: "All that matters is that the energies are retreating. I can already *feel* the curse lifting! It will be a long time until we're *fully* free of it, of course. But still..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Thank you, officer. Truly. You've..."
links.text: "Thank you, officer. Truly. You've brought a better psychoemanation to this humble bookstore and that's no small achievement."

links.title: Drama: "She so badly wants this to be over,..."
links.text: She so badly wants this to be over, she would have believed anything.

links.title: Suggestion: "It will only last a day or two, a w..."
links.text: It will only last a day or two, a week tops. Then her mood will sour and she will feel *the curse* again.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""All right then -- all's well that..."
links.text: "All right then -- all's well that ends well." The lieutenant turns to you. "Should we return to our *ordinary* lives?"

links.title: You: ""Yes. I performed the ancient Semen..."
links.text: "Yes. I performed the ancient Semenese dispelling rites. This commercial area is doomed no more."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Of course. I trust my Semenese war..."
links.text: "Of course. I trust my Semenese wards and charms kept you safe while you performed the ancient rites..." She looks at you with sudden admiration.

links.title: You: ""Yes. I called upon the spirit of *..."
links.text: "Yes. I called upon the spirit of *Guillaume le Million* to banish the curse in a flash of disco brilliance."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Guillaume le Million? The singer w..."
links.text: "Guillaume le Million? The singer who made that awful face? Well... I *do* see the resemblance..." She looks at you with sudden admiration.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I de-spooked it. The curse i..."
links.text: "Yeah, I de-spooked it. The curse is definitely gone."

links.title: Plaisance: ""What does that mean? Are you certa..."
links.text: "What does that mean? Are you certain... Oh, but who am I to question your methods?" She looks at you with sudden admiration.

links.title: You: ""I'm afraid that I can only identif..."
links.text: "I'm afraid that I can only identify the *source*, but you have to call some other experts to lift the curse."

links.title: Plaisance: ""Oh, I see..." She looks at her pen..."
links.text: "Oh, I see..." She looks at her pendant, then back to you. "I guess it's time to visit Boogie Street again."

links.title: Plaisance: ""I'm sure that I'll find someone wh..."
links.text: "I'm sure that I'll find someone who can help me get rid of the doom that still remains in this house... Things are *improving*, I can feel it." She nods.

links.title: You: ""Honestly, I don't have an answer y..."
links.text: "Honestly, I don't have an answer yet. There are still leads to be followed, like that strange radiocomputer-thing..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""You're telling me that you went in..."
links.text: "You're telling me that you went in there and didn't find out *anything* about the curse?!" She looks disappointed.

links.title: Plaisance: ""Of course, I should have known bet..."
links.text: "Of course, I should have known better than to put my hopes on a man like you... You're no Semenese ghostwhisperer, you're an alcoholic!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""The investigation's over. I don't..."
links.text: "The investigation's over. I don't want you going in there anymore, you're only angering the psychic weather in here. Now, if you're not going to *buy* anything..." She turns to face the door, waiting for potential customers.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Wow. Total psychic collapse between..."
links.text: Wow. Total psychic collapse between you two right now.

links.title: Rhetoric: "There was never any other way this..."
links.text: There was never any other way this could have gone. She's just too far gone -- into her own mind.

links.title: Half Light: "Anger and loneliness keep this woma..."
links.text: Anger and loneliness keep this woman moving through the waking hours. Your little words are no match for it.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I am sorry we had to disappoint yo..."
links.text: "I am sorry we had to disappoint you, ma'am." He turns to you. "Can we go now?"

links.title: Shivers: "The shop around you feels ancient s..."
links.text: The shop around you feels ancient suddenly, damp and saturated by the coastal air. The books are rotting, a great cold lives here. And there, too -- 1200 metres away, on the urban coast. The dark shape of a church is reflected on the water, calling.

links.title: You: ""There is another Entity, more mali..."
links.text: "There is another Entity, more malignant, pulling the strings in Martinaise. Perhaps in my travels I will cross paths with it."

links.title: Plaisance: ""A *third order* presence, yes..."..."
links.text: "A *third order* presence, yes..." She lets go of the pendant.

links.title: Empathy: "A great, dark relief washes over he..."
links.text: A great, dark relief washes over her.

links.title: Plaisance: ""I've heard of these *tri-actors*...."
links.text: "I've heard of these *tri-actors*. In certain occult literature that's too dark to dwell on for too long -- and definitely not in the presence of my daughter." She gestures for you to be silent.

links.title: Plaisance: ""I understand everything, sir. Than..."
links.text: "I understand everything, sir. Thank you for descending into the maelstrm. I will keep fort up here -- strengthen the wards, do my best. And if you happen upon the Third Entity in your travels..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""May the Lord be with you." She per..."
links.text: "May the Lord be with you." She performs an x-shaped cross on her chest.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, this has been absolutely *ed..."
links.text: "Well, this has been absolutely *educational*. If we happen on the *Third Presence* in our travels we will certainly come back to tell you."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes, the venture continues. In othe..."
links.text: Yes, the venture continues. In other waters. Darker waters.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He turns to you. "Should we get out..."
links.text: He turns to you. "Should we get out of here -- before the *vortex* collapses?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes, the venture continues. In othe..."
links.text: Yes, the venture continues. In other waters. Darker waters.

links.title: Plaisance: ""I've heard of these *tri-actors*...."
links.text: "I've heard of these *tri-actors*. In certain occult literature that's too dark to dwell on for too long -- and definitely not in public." She gestures for you to be silent.

links.title: You: ""No, ma'am. I have felt her aura. S..."
links.text: "No, ma'am. I have felt her aura. She is not the one to blame for this curse."

links.title: You: ""She may be involved, but I don't h..."
links.text: "She may be involved, but I don't have a way to question the malignant Entity further."

links.title: Plaisance: ""I don't understand. If you're not..."
links.text: "I don't understand. If you're not sure it's her, then where *is* the source of the Doom? How did she explain the *curse*?" She looks perplexed.

links.title: You: ""Plaisance, I have something to tel..."
links.text: "Plaisance, I have something to tell you... I've found the actual source of doom."

links.title: Plaisance: ""What do you mean the *actual* sour..."
links.text: "What do you mean the *actual* source?" She clutches her pendant anxiously. "Are you talking about the... *Third Presence*?"

links.title: Inland Empire: "She remembers. Good."
links.text: She remembers. Good.

links.title: Conceptualization: "No, not presence -- *Absence*."
links.text: No, not presence -- *Absence*.

links.title: You: ""No, not the Presence..." (Close yo..."
links.text: "No, not the Presence..." (Close your eyes.) "The Third *Absence*."

links.title: Plaisance: ""*Absence...!*" she gasps. Then, af..."
links.text: "*Absence...!*" she gasps. Then, after collecting herself: "I imagine things must be rather bleak for you to return to me. Tell me, what have you found?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, the Presence, the Entity, the..."
links.text: "Yes, the Presence, the Entity, the malicious Energy -- however you may want to call it..."

links.title: Plaisance: ""She Who Has Many Names..." she nod..."
links.text: "She Who Has Many Names..." she nods solemnly. "I imagine things must be rather bleak for you to return to me. Tell me, what have you found?"

links.title: Plaisance: ""What do you mean the *actual* sour..."
links.text: "What do you mean the *actual* source?" She clutches her pendant, clearly irritated. "Are you here to lecture me about *economics* again?!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""What do you mean the *actual* sour..."
links.text: "What do you mean the *actual* source?" She clutches her pendant, clearly irritated. "Earlier you told me there was no curse!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""What do you mean the *actual* sour..."
links.text: "What do you mean the *actual* source?" She clutches her pendant anxiously. "I thought this issue was resolved!"

links.title: Plaisance: ""Yes? What news do you bring?" Her..."
links.text: "Yes? What news do you bring?" Her fingers grasp tightly at her pendant.

links.title: You: ""My investigation has led me to dis..."
links.text: "My investigation has led me to discover a two-millimetre entroponetic hole in reality. That's the source of doom -- both in the commercial area *and* in Martinaise."

links.title: Plaisance: ""A... a what?""
links.text: "A... a what?"

links.title: Reaction Speed: "She wasn't expecting this -- at lea..."
links.text: She wasn't expecting this -- at least not the word *entroponetic*.

links.title: You: ""A tiny hole... in reality. It may..."
links.text: "A tiny hole... in reality. It may be connected with pale, an origin point of sorts. It would explain why historically so many things have ended in failure here in Martinaise."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ma'am -- what he's saying is true...."
links.text: "Ma'am -- what he's saying is true. We found an entroponetic anomaly in the Small Pinewood Church down the coast. I don't mean to be an alarmist -- and more research *is* needed -- but... it's not looking good."

links.title: Shivers: "Not for her, not for him, not for R..."
links.text: Not for her, not for him, not for Revachol -- not for Elysium.

links.title: Plaisance: ""But... but... *that's* not in any..."
